channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Linden Foods: Man dies after incident at food processing site
item.description: The Health and Safety Executive and the police are investigating the death at Linden Foods near Dungannon.

item.title: Covid-19: Older people commissioner urges more care home staff to get jab
item.description: Official figures show that more than one in five local care homes are dealing with an outbreak.

item.title: Carnlough: Sea swimmer dies after getting into difficulty
item.description: Emergency services were called to the scene in Carnlough at about 13.30 BST on Wednesday.

item.title: Sinn Féin's Alex Maskey will not stand in next NI Assembly election
item.description: Mr Maskey, the assembly's speaker, says it has been an "honour" to represent communities.

item.title: Covid-19: Hospital procedures in NI decrease by 46%
item.description: New figures highlight the huge reduction in work carried out in the health system due to Covid-19.

item.title: Met Office issues thunderstorm warning for Northern Ireland
item.description: Slow moving showers could bring up to 20mm of rain in an hour, leading to difficult driving conditions.

item.title: Bronze Age sword on display in Fermanagh museum
item.description: The Bronze Age sword had been in private hands since being discovered on the shores of the River Erne in County Fermanagh in 1952.

item.title: Irish FA: Northern Ireland-Switzerland crowd number 'still uncertain' says new president Conrad Kirkwood
item.description: New Irish FA president Conrad Kirkwood says safety will inform the number of spectators allowed to attend Northern Ireland's World Cup qualifier with Switzerland in September.

item.title: Europa Conference League: Larne lose first leg 4-0 to Pacos de Ferreira
item.description: Larne's hopes of progressing in the Europa Conference League were dealt a major blow after they fell to a 4-0 third round qualifying defeat by Pacos de Ferreira in Portugal.

item.title: Northern Ireland deprivation: One in 10 children living with 'food insecurity'
item.description: Food insecurity is a lack of access - or risk of lack of access - to sufficient, varied food.

item.title: Ireland's most expensive ram sells for 44,000 euros
item.description: The ram's County Donegal owner says the record-breaking price is a "once in a lifetime" deal.

item.title: A5 road project exceeds £80m with work yet to start
item.description: The dual carriageway will connect Londonderry to the border at Aughnacloy and beyond to Dublin.

item.title: Car sales in Northern Ireland fall in year-on-year decline
item.description: The exceptional level of sales in 2020 as the first lockdown ended is a major reason for the decrease.

item.title: Northern Ireland firms fined for underpaying staff
item.description: The UK's business minister says there is no excuse for not paying staff the minimum wage.

item.title: Littering: Northern Ireland councils crack down at hotspots
item.description: Three councils in Northern Ireland are using private contractors to tackle littering and dog fouling.

item.title: Covid-19: Three more Covid-linked deaths and 1,641 new cases
item.description: Three more Covid-linked deaths and another 1,641 cases of coronavirus are reported on Thursday.

item.title: All 16 and 17-year-olds in NI to be offered Covid jab
item.description: There are also changes to NI's travel list, with fully-vaccinated arrivals from France no longer required to quarantine.

item.title: Covid-19: Hospital visiting rules tightened by NI health trusts
item.description: Officials have halted or restricted visitors' contact with patients as pressure mounts on services.

item.title: Covid-19: Hospitality vaccine pass 'would be blackmail'
item.description: The head of Hospitality Ulster says restaurants, bars and cafes would be "singled out".

item.title: Covid-19: Balmoral Show needs vaccine or negative test
item.description: A visitor code of conduct asks people to avoid high fives and hugging.

item.title: Covid-19: Are NI's young people resisting the vaccine?
item.description: Why do vaccination numbers among the under-30s in Northern Ireland remain relatively low?

item.title: Q&A: Getting jabbed after NI vaccination centres close for first jabs
item.description: Saturday is the last day to get your first dose of a Covid jab at NI's mass vaccination centres.

item.title: Covid-19: NI vaccination passport service back in action
item.description: People travelling on Sunday should get an email inviting them to download a certificate, say officials.

item.title: Perseid meteor shower to be visible over Northern Ireland
item.description: Potentially hundreds of the brightest meteors will be visible across Northern Ireland in August.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Hikers' plea for help after positive test
item.description: Paul McErlean and his friends were offered a spare caravan by a former UK home secretary.

item.title: Belfast Glider: Decision time for planned new routes
item.description: How can new rapid transit routes in Belfast best serve the city's population?

item.title: Donaghadee: Harbour time capsule recovery could cost £720k
item.description: There is a debate about the exact location of the time capsule buried at the County Down town's harbour.

item.title: Ulster Football Final: Seagulls swoop to see Tyrone triumph at Croke Park as Farney fightback falls just short
item.description: A colony of seagulls joined the 18,000 fans in being enthralled by the Ulster Final at Croke Park as Tyrone held off Monaghan's stirring comeback.

item.title: Cork: How sheep and goats uncovered hidden headstones
item.description: More than 500 graves thought lost forever have been uncovered by volunteers - both animal and human.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Bronze medallist Aidan Walsh tells BBC Sport NI of post Games plans
item.description: Olympic bronze medallist Aidan Walsh and sister Michaela catch up with BBC Sport NI in Tokyo to discuss his Games journey and holiday plans when he arrives home!

item.title: Covid-19: 'I tested positive on the side of a mountain'
item.description: Paul McErlean, from County Londonderry, was hiking near Snowdon when he got a text about the virus.

item.title: Barry's Amusements: Sun due to set on NI's longest-running amusement park
item.description: The seafront entertainment complex has been run by the Trufelli family, who founded the business in 1926.

item.title: Covid-19: Pancreatic cancer surgery cancellation 'devastating' for family
item.description: The family of a man whose surgery for pancreatic cancer was cancelled twice plead for help.

item.title: Praise for man who stopped Londonderry fire spreading
item.description: A resident of the flats says he awoke to find thick smoke in the communal corridor.

item.title: Communions and confirmations to resume, Bishop of Raphoe says
item.description: The Bishop of Raphoe is the fifth Irish bishop to say communions and confirmations will restart.

item.title: Derry City beat Longford to move into sixth
item.description: Derry City beat Longford Town 2-0 in Saturday night's Premier Division game at Bishopsgate to move into sixth place in the table.

item.title: Londonderry: Man taken to hospital after stabbing
item.description: The man was found with injuries to his neck in the early hours of Thursday morning.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish 12-15-year-olds can register for jab from next week
item.description: The plan to extend the country's vaccination programme was announced in July.

item.title: County Cork shootings inquest returns unlawful killing and suicide verdicts
item.description: Inquest says Mark O’Sullivan was unlawfully killed, and records his brother and father took their own lives.

item.title: Covid-19: Electric Picnic festival fails to get council licence
item.description: Laois County Council says the decision was taken in conjunction with the latest public health advice.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Lack of transparency' over Irish decisions
item.description: Academics say there is an absence of clarity about how some decisions were made during the pandemic.

item.title: County Monaghan: Man dies in crash near Castleblayney
item.description: The man was driving one of two cars which collided near Castleblayney.

item.title: Wally the walrus sighted off Waterford
item.description: Wally has been on the islands since June and has travelled thousands of miles around Europe.
